newsitem.title: KAZAKHSTAN: Russian soldiers kill three on Tajik-Afghan border.
newsitem.headline: Russian soldiers kill three on Tajik-Afghan border.

text.p: Three people trying to slip into Tajikistan from neighbouring Afghanistan were shot dead by Russian border guards late on Friday, a guards' spokesman said.
Speaking by phone on Saturday, he said the incident had taken place some 200 km (125 miles) south of Dushanbe.
The dead had been trying to carry 60 kg (132 lbs) of narcotics into Tajikistan, he added.
Russian border guards in Tajikistan say they have so far this year intercepted over 600 kg (1,320 lbs) of drugs coming into the former Soviet republic from Afghanistan.
The drugs -- opium and its derivatives -- make their way across Tajikistan to other republics of the former Soviet Union and into Eastern Europe.

Around 20,000 Russian peacekeepers and border guards serve in Tajikistan -- a remote, mountainous Central Asian state which also borders China -- viewing themselves as a bulwark against a possible advent of militant Islam from Afghanistan.

Despite a ceasefire agreed last December between the secular government and the country's united Islamist opposition, which ended a four-year civil war, Tajikistan remains unsettled as groups of fighters with unclear loyalties and drug couriers continue to operate from bases in Afghanistan.
